= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state of being integrated but physically detached from other, similar objects or events
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself

= inhabitant of Philistia (פְּלֶשֶׁת) considered to have come from Kaphtor (כַּפְתֹּור)

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for

= state in which objects have recently attained a particular state
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= town; ◄ in western Negeb (נֶגֶב) not far from Gaza (עַזָּה) ► inhabited by Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי) one of the places where Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Isaac (יִצְחָק) sojourned
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= a well, ◄ dug by herdsmen of Isaac (יִצְחָק) which became a source of contention between them and the herdsmen of Gerar (גְּרָר)

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= a well, ◄ dug by herdsmen of Isaac (יִצְחָק) which became a source of contention between them and the herdsmen of Gerar (גְּרָר)

Node.gloss: to move (from one place to another)
Node.definition: = action by which humans pack their belongings and move to another location; ≈ associated with nomadic life

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
literally: to cry out (someone's) name (something); hence: = action by which humans assign a name to a person or place
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= a well, ◄ dug by herdsmen of Isaac (יִצְחָק) which, unlike the wells of Esek (עֵשֶׂק) and Sitnah (שִׂטְנָה) did not become a source of contention between them and the herdsmen of Gerar (גְּרָר)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place
literally: to enlarge (for someone); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant relief to (other) humans by alleviating difficult circumstances
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.gloss: to be seen|to become visible|to appear
Node.definition: = process by which humans, deities, or objects become perceptible, primarily though not necessarily exclusively to the eye
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a person’s child or children, or the young of an animal

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of|because of
Node.definition: = particle linking proposition X to participant Y, by which Y represents the cause or beneficiary of X
= man, also known as Abram (אַבְרָם) ◄ son of Terah (תֶּרַח) ► first patriarch of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Ishmael (יִשְׁמָעֵאל) and Isaac (יִצְחָק)

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
= construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to stretch out (one's) tent; hence: = causative action by which humans erect their tent by stretching out the tent curtains over a structure of poles
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= action by which humans break up and move earth or stone, usually with a tool, and with the purpose of creating a hole

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= name or title of man; ► king of Gerar (גְּרָר)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= town; ◄ in western Negeb (נֶגֶב) not far from Gaza (עַזָּה) ► inhabited by Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי) one of the places where Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Isaac (יִצְחָק) sojourned
= man; ► adviser (מֵרֵעַ) to Abimelech (אֲבִימֶלֶךְ) king of Gerar (גְּרָר) time of the patriarchs
= a person with whom someone has a bond of mutual affection and respect and trust
= man; ► commander of army of Abimelech (אֲבִימֶלֶךְ) king of Philistines (פְּלִשְׁתִּי)
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= relatively large group of people, usually with centralized leadership; ► assembled for a common purpose, such as warfare or a journey

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to send away|to divorce|to expel|to remove|to cast out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which the name of a deity is invoked and asked to punish a wrong doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups
= a relationship linking two or more individuals or groups

Node.gloss: to make a covenant|to make a treaty
Node.definition: literally: to cut (a covenant); hence: = action by which two or more parties make a solemn agreement, accompanied by stipulations, blessings, and curses
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes
literally: to touch; hence: = causative action by which humans, deities or forces cause harm to humans or objects
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to send away|to divorce|to expel|to remove|to cast out
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities force (other) humans to go away from a certain location and/or position; ◄ due to a lack of affection, as punishment, or for other reasons
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

Node.gloss: to bless|to praise|to greet|to congratulate|to commend
Node.definition: = causative action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, or events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
literally: drinking; hence: = a banquet meal or feast with honored guests
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

Node.gloss: a man ... his brother > one ... each other
Node.definition: = expression denoting a situation in which two people or objects that are regarded as masculine are involved in a reciprocal event

Node.gloss: to let go|to dismiss|to send (someone) on his way|to free|to release
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities allow (other) humans to leave a certain place and go home
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)
marker that introduces an object or event that is regarded as directly or indirectly responsible for the event in focus

= hole in the ground that reaches underground water; ◄ usually manmade, dug out of the ground, or hewn from rock, but may also be naturally occurring; ► used for accessing, collecting and storing water; used by shepherds as a source of water for their animals; ≈ regarded as a source of life because of its water; sometimes used as a metaphor for a woman, possibly based on the physical resemblance of the well to the vagina and its connotation as a source of life
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= causative action by which humans create a hole in the earth by breaking up and moving earth, usually with a digging tool; ► in order to hide something, to set a trap, or to find something that one is searching for

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= well, ◄ dug by servants of Isaac (יִצְחָק) later named Beer Sheba (בְּאֵר שֶׁבַע)
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

m.definition: = town; ◄ located in the Negeb (נֶגֶב) at the southern border of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► used esp. in combination with Dan (דָּן) at the northern border of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) to refer to all Israel

Node.definition: particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= man; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and older brother of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) ► who sold his birthright for a bowl of lentil stew; regarded as ancestor of the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי)
= state in which humans and animals have a certain age, ◄ referred to as a child of a certain number of years
= state in which a countable entity is forty in number
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman; ◄ daughter of Beeri (בְּאֵרִי) ► wife of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ◄ Hittite; ► father of Judith (יְהוּדִית) wife of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= member of ethnic group inhabiting Canaan (כְּנַעַן) before arrival of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ◄ regarded as descendants of Heth (חֵת)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= woman; ◄ daughter of Elon (אֵילֹון) ► wife of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption
= man; ► father of Basemath (בָּשְׂמַת) wife of Esau (עֵשָׂו)
= member of ethnic group inhabiting Canaan (כְּנַעַן) before arrival of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ◄ regarded as descendants of Heth (חֵת)
literally: bitterness; hence: = state in which humans are in deep distress
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= man; ◄ son of Abraham (אַבְרָהָם) and Sarah (שָׂרָה) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) father of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jacob (יַעֲקֹב)
= woman; ◄ daughter of Bethuel (בְּתוּאֵל) sister of Laban (לָבָן) ► wife of Isaac (יִצְחָק) mother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and Jakob (יַעֲקֹב)
